interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: I, Claudius (35th Anniversary Edition)
Review Date: 2019/01/03
Store: Sian Phillips  (Actor),     Derek Jacobi  (Actor)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
Product Description: ['"A true masterpiece" —', 'San Francisco Chronicle', '"Fiendishly sophisticated" —', 'The New York Times', '"Handsomely produced, grandly acted, and…thoroughly involving" —', 'The Washington Post', '"Irresistible, witty" —', 'Los Angeles Times', 'Rated one of the "100 Best TV Shows of All Time" by Time magazine, this epic BBC series spans the history of the Roman Empire from Augustus through Claudius, a stuttering scholar who learns early to play the fool and stay alive. Based on the novels by Robert Graves, it stars Derek Jacobi (', 'The King’s Speech', ',', 'Cadfael', ') in a career-defining role. Siân Phillips (', 'The Age of Innocence', ') is “exquisitely wicked” (Los Angeles Times) as the lethal Livia, wife to Augustus (Brian Blessed,', 'Hamlet', '), while John Hurt (', 'The Elephant Man', ') is "decadence personified" (', 'USA Today', ') as the depraved Caligula, whose reign of terror paves the way for Claudius’s ascension.', 'Winner of an Emmy® and numerous other awards, this riveting tale of ambition, debauchery, and intrigue remains one of the most popular and acclaimed dramas in Masterpiece Theatre history. Patrick Stewart (', 'X-Men', '), George Baker (', 'The Ruth Rendell Mysteries', '), Margaret Tyzack (', 'Cousin Bette', '), and James Faulkner (', 'The Bank Job', ') also star.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama/Television, Television/British Television', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Patrick Stewart, John Hurt, Sian Phillips, Derek Jacobi', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '5', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 4.64 Ounces', 'Item model number': '8750', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '11 hours and 8 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 5, 2012', 'Actors': 'Sian Phillips, Derek Jacobi, Patrick Stewart, John Hurt', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'ACORN MEDIA', 'Number of discs': '5'}
Review Text: Films are made for a particular time.  This is very good, but of more interest to historians.
Review Title: Time has made less relevant
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Queen Margot [VHS]
Rated:    Unrated    Format: VHS Tape
Movies & TV, Art House & International, By Country, France
['Product Description', "A classic tale of intrigue and forbidden love, QUEEN MARGOT is the powerful hit universally acclaimed by critics! Thrown into a political marriage of convenience by her ruthlessly power-hungry family, the beautiful Margot (Isabelle Adjani -- CAMILLE CLAUDEL) soon finds herself hopelessly drawn into their murderous affairs. It's then she realizes that her only hope of escape lies somewhere between the heroic soldier who loves her and the enemy husband who could save her! Triumphant winner of 5 Cesar Awards the pretigious Cannes Film Festival Jury Prize -- you're sure to be entertained by this vivid portrayal of passion, revenge, and extraordinary courage!", 'Amazon.com', 'Based on a novel by Alexandre Dumas,', 'Queen Margot', "concerns the events behind infamous Massacre of St. Bartholomew in 16th-century France. Isabelle Adjani plays Margot, betrothed for political reasons to one man (Daniel Auteuil) by her mother (Virna Lisi), while she is, in fact, in love with another (Vincent Pérez). Despite the bond that grows between the reluctant couple, plots are hatching all over the castle against the royals. Adventurous, exciting, erotic, and given strong artistic credibility through its outstanding cast, the film is enthralling and visually sumptuous. Directed by Patrice Chereau, less known outside of France than is the film's producer, Claude Berri (director of", 'Jean de Florette', 'and', 'Manon of the Spring', ').', '--Tom Keogh']
{'Format': 'Color, Dolby, Subtitled, NTSC, HiFi Sound', 'Contributor': 'Adjani, Anglade, Auteuil', 'Language': 'Russian', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '7.32 x 4.19 x 1.12 inches; 6.13 Ounces', 'Release date': 'April 30, 1996', 'Date First Available': 'September 29, 2006', 'Actors': 'Adjani, Auteuil, Anglade', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Miramax', 'Country of Origin': 'USA'}
Not the Queen Margot I expected.  It had subtitles and a different plot.
One Star

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Medium Preference**: The user remains passionate about films, particularly in the international and art house genres, with a sustained interest in French cinema.
- **Format Preference**: They continue to favor physical media formats, particularly VHS, valuing the nostalgia of traditional viewing while also diversifying to include DVD formats.
- **Critical Engagement**: The user's discerning approach to films persists, as they begin with high expectations and exhibit sensitivity to perceived biases. They appreciate artistic integrity and quality narratives, although their latest review indicates a shift towards valuing historical and scholarly insights in storytelling.
- **Subtitles**: Although still generally disliking subtitles, the user is becoming more open to engaging with subtitled content that aligns with their interests.
- **Ratings**: Reflective ratings highlight a focus on narrative coherence and thematic depth. Recent interactions show varied ratings, indicating a careful appraisal of emotional and historical relevance in stories.
- **Themes of Interest**: They continue to be drawn to themes of romance, political intrigue, and historical narratives, favoring clarity and alignment with personal values.
- **User Experience**: While valuing accessible viewing experiences, they express that time can diminish a film's relevance, revealing a nuanced understanding of storytelling in the context of its era. The user appreciates diverse perspectives that foster thought, aiming for an engaging emotional impact alongside thematic depth.
